name: Entrepreneur First
slogan: Builds companies that transform industries or creates new ones from scratch
description:
Entrepreneur First is the world’s leading talent investor. We specialise in supporting people to build technically defensible companies from scratch. Companies founded on our programme solve hard problems, often using unique and cutting-edge technology. 

We fund you as an individual, then help you meet your cofounder and develop an idea. We then fund at preseed and help your new company raise from the worlds best seed investors. So far, we’ve helped 1,500+ people create 200+ companies, worth a combined $1.7bn.

Apply to one of our programmes in London, Singapore, Berlin, Hong Kong, Paris and Bangalore.

jobs.title: Form Intern, Berlin
jobs.description:
Entrepreneur First Berlin | Visiting Analyst (Intern)

About EF
Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to become founders. Today we are the world’s leading talent investor: we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.
Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 1,200 individuals build more than 200 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.
EF itself is backed by some of the world’s best investors, including the founders of LinkedIn, DeepMind and PayPal and runs cohorts in London, Singapore, Hong Kong, Berlin, Paris and Bangalore.

What you’ll do
This is a rare opportunity to be part of the local EF Berlin team, with exposure to the world’s most ambitious and talented individuals. You will support the EF Berlin team in getting everything up and running in a short time frame. You will work closely with experienced operations professionals with a variety of backgrounds, who are invested in helping you develop your career.
From reaching out to talented candidates, to organizing events and liaising with our global team in London, Singapore and Hong Kong, you’ll have exposure to a wide and meaningful set of tasks. No two days will be the same. You’ll also help to build and maintain our local culture, a critical success factor for us as we scale across the world.

Who you are
This role will suit an early career professional, either recently graduated or considering a career change after a few years. You will want exposure to high growth start-ups, venture capital investment, operations and / or technology. You will reflect the following:
You enjoy working as part of a team
You pride yourself on your clear communication skills
You’re an infinite learner, keen to learn from your colleagues and encouraged by the challenge of being part of a newly formed office
You understand the power of well-organised operations and enjoy making things work smoothly
You are comfortable handling unknown or changing priorities at short notice
You like to take initiative and are a strong problem-solver
You have some solid operational experience, and are used to taking ownership of tasks, including analytical or critical thinking
You are connected to or have strong interest in the entrepreneurial/start-up scene in Berlin

AT EF you'll get to:
Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most exceptional individuals and have the opportunity to work in an institution that can change the way the most ambitious people think about their careers.
Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team.
Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in the region

Remuneration and term
This is a paid position on a 6 month term
Start date is in December/January


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Talent & Fundraising Analyst (Intern), Paris
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First
Entrepreneur First is the world's leading talent investor.
We invest in the world’s most ambitious technologists to help them build world-class deep tech startups from scratch. Since 2011, we’ve created over 260+ startups worth over $1.6 billion including Tractable, OpenCosmos, CloudNC and Cleo. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology, which was acquired by Twitter for $150m. EF is backed by Reid Hoffman (founder of LinkedIn) and Greylock Partners, Mosaic Ventures, Founders Fund, Lakestar and some of the world's best entrepreneurs.
It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Since 2011, we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. No other organisation has access to this.

Responsibilities
As an intern in the Talent & Funding teams, you will be helping us attract and convince the world’s best technical individuals to build deep tech startups and contribute to their fundraising strategy. Your  main missions will be set around:

- Engagement and conversion: You will be given a selection of the highest-potential individuals to build relationships with. You will be meeting people who EF wants to talk to and it will be your mission to get them intrigued to meet and find out more. In line with our data-driven approach to talent acquisition, you will also be asked to monitor our dashboards and metrics and pay close attention to our KPIs.

- Community and partnerships with key stakeholders: At the heart of EF’s long term defensibility is our ability to attract the best talent. Building long term strategic relationships with key talent feeder organisations (e.g., schools, universities, research centers, student associations, French Tech ecosystem) through partnerships or networking is key. Your internship will also be a great opportunity to interact with the broader tech and venture capital community in Paris as we increasingly extend our reach.

- Demo Day and Investor Month organization: Once we have invested in deeptech companies, we need to make sure that our companies are up and ready for Demo Day, where they pitch in front of 500 of the best european investors . You will be contributing to their preparation for this big event (helping on their pitch and fundraising deck) and will make sure that every relevant VC and Business Angel is invited to meet our teams during office hours.

- Events management and operations: EF runs a lot of events with EF speakers and external deep tech stakeholders, and you will be responsible for everything from finding speakers to ensuring the evening runs smoothly. This will include liaising with speakers and venues, and taking responsibility for marketing. You will get the opportunity to sit in on these events and learn from inspiring entrepreneurs.


You will also get to:
- Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to help develop an institution that can change the way the most ambitious people think about their careers
- Supercharge your learning - you will have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team
- Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in France
- Be based at Station F, at the heart of the French tech ecosystem

Experience
You should:
- Have a strong academic record
- Have an interest in technology, startups and venture capital
- Have already interned at a top tier company or startup
- Be perfectly fluent in English

Requirements
You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role.
You should also:
- Be an expert problem solver who thinks on their feet
- Have high EQ and enjoy working with people
- Have a strong growth mindset and actively seek ownership
- Have outstanding organisational skills
- Be a strong communicator
- Be very comfortable with managing competing priorities

Remuneration: You will be paid 1,500 euros per month.  
Location: You will be based in EF's offices at Station F, 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris.
Start Date: Mid-June / early July 2020 for 6 months
https://www.joinef.com/


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Talent Manager, Toronto
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First
Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor - we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.

Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 2000 individuals build more than 230 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.
EF now faces the biggest and most exciting challenge in its history: scaling to become a globally important institution. To be accessible and attractive to the world’s most ambitious people, we’re opening our inaugural North American cohort in Toronto, with the first 50 candidates starting in Q2 2020. 

The Role
The Talent Manager is an exciting role that will own and develop a huge part of our business in Toronto. It’s a massive role, which offers an enormous opportunity for immediate impact on our business, a large amount of responsibility, and a steep and continued learning curve. This isn’t a conventional talent acquisition role - you’ll be recruiting the potential founders of some of the world’s most important tech companies.

We are very ambitious for the future of Entrepreneur First and we believe that we have a unique opportunity to understand and develop the secret finding individuals who can build billion dollar companies. No other investor or company has access to this opportunity. 

What you’ll do:
* Manage the Talent team, responsible for the delivery of full cohorts back to back.
* Implement local talent strategy. You'll continuously transfer knowledge and sharing learnings with our global teams
* Work directly with the General Manager to execute local talent strategy according to company goals.
* Direct and track both high and low touch recruitment efforts
* Work with other key internal stakeholders from other teams.
* Conduct weekly check ins with Talent team members, set quarterly team goals (OKRs) 
 *Report weekly on key metrics and team performance.
*Lead and manage Partner Programmes with universities, students and communities.
* Lead bi-annual review cycle for the team.
* Hiring and growing the team.

About You:
Skills
* Drive for results - you create focus, consistently measure performance against goals and evaluate results.
Pipeline Management - you’re analytical and think in terms of pipelines. You dig deep to make improvements at every stage.
* Managing and measuring work - you can set stretching performance goals with clear measurables
* Upward management/reporting - you create tight feedback loops and can present clear headlines to important stakeholders. You know when the detail is needed.
* Problem-solving and planning - you instinctively anticipate and adjust for problems and roadblocks. You solve them with logic.
* Influencing and closing - you know how to set specific goals which lead towards desired outcomes and have a good sense of timing.

Experience
* Building and managing high-performance teams - you’ve had experience setting stretch goals for direct reports and have proven experience delivering results. You’re great at giving continuous feedback and getting the best out of your team and share wins.
* Pipeline-driven workflows - you’re familiar working with high-volume pipelines, leads, pass rates, and engagement metrics. You’re familiar making short-term and long-term ROI decisions.
* Sales or Talent experience - you have been a manager in either a sales or recruitment team in a high-growth organisation.
* Tech talent insights - you have an understanding of the tech talent landscape and know who the big players are.
* Startup knowledge - you’ve worked with or for startups and have a good view of the local ecosystem. A strong network is a plus.

Personal traits
* Motivating others - you enjoys developing people and purposefully connecting their work to the larger mission.
* Proactive - you don’t delay action pending instruction or permission.
* Data-driven - you intuitively understand the value of data and making decisions based on empirical information.
* Creative - you can come up with new and unique ideas, and make connections among previously unrelated notions.
* Storyteller - you can sell a vision and get people bought into our strong beliefs.

Benefits
In addition to the financial compensation, the benefits of working at EF include:
* Surrounding yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to be an early employee at an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people approach entrepreneurship in Canada. The potential impact is enormous.
* Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work in a talented, ambitious, and committed team of specialists.
* Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best technologists, founders, investors and high net worth individuals.
* Working in a buzzing space full of technical founders and being part of an enthusiastic and fast-paced team.
* In addition to 23 holiday days to use flexibly between January and December, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year.
* A Learning and Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development.
* A Wellness allowance: everyone gets a wellness allowance to be spent on things that enhance your health and wellbeing e.g. gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace etc.
* Annual retreats with our Global team
* A generous maternity and paternity pay and leave policies. We care about your families and we want to enable you to achieve the right balance between your home and working life.

Remuneration  
This is a Manager level role, with a competitive salary and performance based remuneration. This role can expect significant upside from our fund through our carry plan.
Location: You will be based in EF's Toronto office (location TBD), with periodic training in London. You will report to the General Manager of EF Toronto and manage a team of Associates.
Start Date: March 2020, with our inaugural cohort starting Q2 2020.


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual preference, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Brand Marketing Associate [Asia]
jobs.description:
ABOUT ENTREPRENEUR FIRST

Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor; we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.

Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 1,900 individuals build more than 300 companies, with a total valuation of almost $2 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the founders met on the EF programme.

EF itself is backed by some of the world’s best investors, including the founders of LinkedIn, DeepMind and PayPal and runs cohorts in London, Singapore, Toronto, Berlin, Paris and Bangalore.

THE ROLE

We are looking for a Brand Marketing Associate to manage all marketing activities across Entrepreneur First’s Asian locations. You’ll be based in Singapore, and be a part of the global Growth & Marketing team (which is based across London & Singapore offices) who are responsible for all marketing activity across the company, and report into the Brand Marketing Lead. This is an excellent opportunity to learn from people who care deeply about the ways in which brand can shape an organisation, internally as well as externally. Your work will help establish Entrepreneur First as the destination of choice for the world’s most ambitious and talented people, helping them realise their potential by founding their own companies.

Responsibilities
Manage all PR activities in your region, including:
 - working closely with PR agencies & General Managers in each location to ensure regular coverage in major publications
 - defining the strategic objectives for each location’s PR, and being responsible for the day-to-day management & delivery
Being the go-to marketer for your region, including:
 - developing marketing materials for a variety of audiences, from investors to potential entrepreneurs
 - supporting local teams with all collateral from a brand tone of voice & design perspective
 - supporting local teams in marketing their events, including Demo Days and talks with high-profile speakers
When required, work with external agencies and central Growth & Marketing team to manage the production and delivery of advertising, stunts or other Marketing activity in your region

About You
 - Excited about the potential to build a global brand
 - 2+ years’ experience either working in an advertising or PR agency, or in a role where you managed external agencies
 - A personal interest in brand, marketing, and communications
 - Excellent written and verbal communicationA creative spirit and an eye for strong, impactful design
 - Confident in directing your own work and acting with autonomy
 - Able to work with teams across the globe to make sure the brand is well-represented
 - Excited by the prospect of travel between the locations in your region

Remuneration & Benefits
You will receive a competitive salary, dependent upon your experience, with additional upside via a carry share in the returns in our funds’ profits. 

In addition to the financial compensation, the benefits of working at EF include:

 - Surrounding yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to be an early employee at an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people approach entrepreneurship. The potential impact is enormous.
 - Supercharge your learning - you’ll have the opportunity to work with a talented, ambitious, and committed team of specialists.
 - Embed yourself within the EF community - we work with the best technologists, founders, and investors and many people take their next role within the community after EF.
 - In addition to 23 holiday days to use flexibly between January and December, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year.
 - A $680 SGD Learning & Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development.
 - A $680 SGD Wellness allowance: everyone gets a wellness allowance to be spent on things that enhance your health and wellbeing e.g. gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace etc.
 - Generous maternity and paternity pay and leave policies. We care about your families and we want to enable you to achieve the right balance between your home and working life.
 - Health insurance coverage provided by AXA


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a wide variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status. We welcome applications from candidates of all protected characteristics, and if you require any special arrangements for interview, please contact naph@joinef.com

jobs.title: Entrepreneur in Residence
jobs.description:
# **Entrepreneur-in-Residence**

Berlin

**Entrepreneur-in-Residence**

**About Entrepreneur First (EF)**

Entrepreneur First brings together the world’s most ambitious people to build deep tech startups from scratch in Paris, London, Berlin, Hong Kong and Singapore. We invest in exceptional individuals even before they have a team or an idea and help them find a cofounder, develop ideas, and subsequently raise funding from investors to build the world’s most valuable tech companies.

To date we have helped build 150 companies with a total valuation of over $1.5 billion. They're funded by leading VCs and angel investors from across Europe, Asia and the US, including Index Ventures, Balderton Capital, and Y Combinator. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony, led by Rob Bishop and Zehan Wang, which was acquired by Twitter for a reported US$150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.

Most recently, we have raised US$12.4M in a round led by Reid Hoffman, founder of LinkedIn, with participation from Greylock Partners, Founders Fund and other top US venture capital firms as well as the Deep Mind founders.

**The Role**

We are looking for an **Entrepreneur-in-Residence** for the Form team in Berlin, who will deliver the EF process of helping build startups from scratch. This is a role with enormous opportunity for immediate impact.

The **Form Team** at EF Berlin creates the platform for the world’s highest potential individuals to achieve the impact they are capable of. This means turning each selected cohort of 50+ individuals into world-class startups. After the Form stage, EF invests and the Launch Team prepares them for external funding. It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Over the past 5 years we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. This is the EiR's ‘North Star’. [Read this](https://medium.com/entrepreneur-first/21st-century-alchemy-bf655d1b543a) to find out why Form matters.

**EiR Responsibilities:**

The Form Team handles the EF experience from the moment people are selected to join until they have an investable startup. The EiR will help specifically with 2 core aspects of Form:

**Team building -** Crack the code for building teams from scratch.

We have developed a robust team-building methodology based on our 6 years of experience in the London, Singapore, Berlin and Hong Kong cohorts, which have resulted in over 150 seed-funded companies to date. Your mission is to build as many strong teams as possible.

- Work with sole founders to help them progress into teams
- Provide deep and nuanced advice to teams and individuals 
- Actively manage team breakups and formation.
- Develop and refine EF's team-building frameworks.
- Use EF's historical data to create optimal co-founding teams.

**Ideation -** Ensure the teams work on high-potential ideas

We are in a privileged position in being able to shape how our founding teams think about generating and testing their ideas, right at the inception of the company. This can radically change the trajectory of a company for the better. Your mission is to make these ideas as high potential as possible within the constraints of the founders combined skills and insights.

- Work with EF founders to develop their ideas.
- Develop and refine EF's frameworks on ideation
- Mentor the teams through the first 3.5 months of idea validation and customer development    

**You should ideally have:**

- Demonstrated experience as a founder in one or more startups, or as a senior executive in one or more early-stage, high-growth companies
- Demonstrated knowledge of early-stage startup development and funding of technology companies
- Demonstrated ability to ramp up quickly in understanding the key attributes of technologies, products, markets and teams that lead to successful startups

**You also:**

- Possess a high EQ and enjoy mentoring and developing entrepreneurs
- Are driven to solve problems and create real, tangible impact
- Have a ‘Hands-on’ work ethic - we are looking for people who just get things done and actively seek ownership

**Bonus points for:**

- A technical or scientific background
- Experience as a founder and an advisor to early stage companies

**You'll also get to:**

- Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most exceptional individuals and have the opportunity to work in an institution that can change the way the most ambitious people think about their careers.
- Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team.
- Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in the region

**Commitment:** 3-5 days a week. 3-6 months (negotiable). Most of our EiRs either go on to found another company or join the EF team on a permanent basis.

**Location** : You’ll be based at our offices in Berlin (Kreuzberg)

**Start Date** : ASAP

  • Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most exceptional individuals and have the opportunity to work in an institution that can change the way the most ambitious people think about their careers.
  • Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team.
  • Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in the region

Commitment: 3-5 days a week. 3-6 months (negotiable). Most of our EiRs either go on to found another company or join the EF team on a permanent basis.

Location : You’ll be based at our offices in Berlin (Kreuzberg)

Start Date : ASAP

jobs.title: Entrepreneur in Residence, Toronto
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First
Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor - we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.
Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 2000 individuals build more than 230 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.
EF now faces the biggest and most exciting challenge in its history: scaling to become a globally important institution. To be accessible and attractive to the world’s most ambitious people, we’re opening our inaugural North American cohort in Toronto, with the first 50 candidates starting in Q2 2020. 
 
The Role
We are on the lookout for an Entrepreneur-in-Residence who will deliver the EF process of helping build startups from scratch. This is a role with enormous opportunity for immediate impact, a steep learning curve, as well as long term incentives and development.
The Form Team creates the platform for the world’s highest potential people to achieve the impact they are capable of. This means turning each selected cohort of 100+ individuals into world class startups. After the Form stage, EF invests and the Launch Team prepares them for external funding.
It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Over the past 8 years we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia. EF's 230+ alumni companies are now worth >$1.5bn USD. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. This is the Form EiR's ‘North Star’.
Read this to find out why Form matters.
 
EiR Responsibilities:
The Form Team handles the EF experience from the moment people are selected to join until they have an investable startup. The EiR will help specifically with 2 core aspects of Form: 
Team building - Crack the code for building teams from scratch.
We have developed a robust team-building methodology based on our 8 years of experience in the London, Singapore, Berlin, Paris, Bangalore and Hong Kong cohorts, which have resulted in over 150 seed-funded companies to date. Your mission is to build as many strong teams as possible.
Work with sole founders to help them progress into teams
Provide deep and nuanced advice to teams and individuals 
Actively manage team breakups and formation.
Develop and refine EF's team-building frameworks.
Use EF's historical data to create optimal co-founding teams.
Ideation - Ensure the teams work on high-potential ideas
We are in a privileged position in being able to shape how our founding teams think about generating and testing their ideas, right at the inception of the company. This can radically change the trajectory of a company for the better. Your mission is to make these ideas as high potential as possible within the constraints of the founders combined skills and insights.
Work with EF founders to develop their ideas.
Develop and refine EF's frameworks on ideation
Mentor the teams through the first 3.5 months of idea validation and customer development    
 You should ideally have:
Demonstrated experience as a founder in one or more startups, or as a senior executive in one or more early-stage, high-growth companies
Demonstrated knowledge of early-stage startup development and funding of technology companies
Demonstrated ability to ramp up quickly in understanding the key attributes of technologies, products, markets and teams that lead to successful startups 
You also:
Possess a high EQ and enjoy mentoring and developing entrepreneurs
Are driven to solve problems and create real, tangible impact
Have a ‘Hands-on’ work ethic - we are looking for people who just get things done and actively seek ownership
Bonus points for:
A technical or scientific background
Experience as a founder and an advisor to early stage companies
 Training and development
Your experience will be invaluable, but nobody builds startups like EF. We will teach you method we have taken 8 years to create. You’ll work with Toronto’s General Manager (François Le Nguyen), Toronto’s Form Manager and the international Form team to hone this method.
Reporting: You will report to the Toronto’s General Manager, and be supported a team of Analysts and Associates.
Benefits
In addition to the financial compensation, the benefits of working at EF include:
Surrounding yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to be an early employee at an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people approach entrepreneurship in Canada. The potential impact is enormous.
Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work in a talented, ambitious, and committed team of specialists.
Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best technologists, founders, investors and high net worth individuals.
Working in a buzzing space full of technical founders and being part of an enthusiastic and fast-paced team.
In addition to 23 holiday days to use flexibly between January and December, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year.
A Learning and Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development.
A Wellness allowance: everyone gets a wellness allowance to be spent on things that enhance your health and wellbeing e.g. gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace etc.
Annual retreats with our Global team
A generous maternity and paternity pay and leave policies. We care about your families and we want to enable you to achieve the right balance between your home and working life.


Remuneration: 
This is an important role for EF, on top a competitive salary, you will have significant upside via returns in our funds’ profits. We want you to live comfortably, but be incentivised by great outcomes for the portfolio.
Commitment: 3-5 days a week. 6-12 months (negotiable). Most of our EiRs either go on to found another company or join the EF team on a permanent basis.
Location:  You’ll be based at our Toronto Office (location TBD) with periodic training in London.
Start Date:  January 2020 in preparation for our inaugural cohort starting in Q2 2020 and can be either Part-time or Full-time. 


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.description:
**About Entrepreneur First**  
Entrepreneur First is the world’s leading talent investor.  Since 2012, we’ve pioneered a new model of company creation, with over 2,000 individuals having taken our programmes in London, Singapore, Berlin, Paris and Bangalore, with Toronto also launching in 2020.  To date, they’ve created 150+ seed funded companies with a combined valuation of over $2 billion, including Magic Pony Technology (AI, acquired by Twitter), Represent (social commerce, acquired by CustomInk), BloomsburyAI (acquired by Facebook), Tractable (AI), OpenCosmos (space) and many more.   
We’re proud to be backed by renowned investors such as Reid Hoffman (LinkedIn),  Demis Hassabis (Google’s Deepmind) and Taavet Hinrikus (TransferWise), fueling our ambitious plan to create hundreds more impactful start ups in the next few years.  Our team is central to shaping, enabling and supporting this journey, bringing exciting growth focused opportunities as part of our programme delivery or global functions.  
  
**The Role**  
A key member of our global Finance function, the Finance Manager will play a business partnering role to teams across Europe, supporting EF to scale and evolve.  Being both hands on in driving core work forwards, plus strategic in planning and delivering projects, the role will suit someone excited to continually seek new experiences and learning as part of a dynamic, thriving team.  
  
**What You'll Do**  
* Own the balance sheet across 5 entities in the UK, France and Germany* Prepare budgets and quarterly forecasts for your designated P&L’s* Manage a Finance Associate in London, providing support and development* Partner with the Head of Finance to improve reporting and other processes* Work on impactful projects including Finance software implementation* Build strong relationships with key stakeholders locally and internationally* Provide ad-hoc Finance related updates to ExCo to aid strategic decision making  
  
**What You’ll Need*** CIMA/ACCA/ACA qualified, with 2+ years relevant experience in a high growth, fast paced environment* Prior line management experience would be advantageous* Exposure to projects such as accounting software implementation* A hands on approach, with the ability to juggle multiple tasks at the same time* A love of tackling challenges and finding solutions* Willingness to go the extra mile to continually strive for excellence* A shared belief that start ups can shape the future, bringing positive change  
  
**What We Offer***  A competitive salary and a share of the fund’s “carry” - any profit the fund returns* A buzzing space full of technical founders working on cutting-edge, world changing businesses* The opportunity to supercharge your learning by working with a talented, ambitious and supportive global team who are passionate about inclusivity* Generous holidays: in addition to 23 days holiday, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year* A Learning & Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development* A Wellness allowance to spend on things enhancing your health and wellbeing, e.g. gym membership, yoga classes, Vitality, subscription to Headspace etc* Enhanced maternity and paternity pay, plus broader leave policies. We care about our team and enabling the right balance between home and working life* Salary sacrifice schemes: cycle to work and technology (phones, laptops, fitness watches etc)    
**Location & Start date:** The role will be based in our London HQ and will start ASAP / 1st May.  
  
EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a wide variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Form Manager, Toronto
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First
Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor - we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.  Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 2000 individuals build more than 230 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.

EF now faces the biggest and most exciting challenge in its history: scaling to become a globally important institution. To be accessible and attractive to the world’s most ambitious people, we’re opening our inaugural North American cohort in Toronto, with the first 50 candidates starting in Q2 2020. 
On top of being operationally exciting, this role offers you the chance to be part of the founding team, creating EF culture abroad, and work on the IP for the company’s most crucial scaling mechanism.

The Form Manager will own the process of building startups from scratch in our Toronto office - how we turn individuals into teams, and how we develop world changing ideas. This is a high responsibility role with an opportunity for immediate impact, a steep learning curve, as well as long-term incentives and development. 
At EF, the Form Team enables the world’s most ambitious individuals to build world changing companies. This means identifying a cohort of 100+ individuals and helping turn them into world-class startups. After the Form stage, EF invests and the Launch Team prepares them for external funding. 
It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Over the past 8 years, we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. No other organisation has access to this. This is the Form Manager's ‘North Star’.
Read this to find out why the Form matters.
 
Responsibilities
You will manage the team that runs EF Toronto's Form programme. This is the main company building part of EF and is a 14 week programme that begins from when we offer an individual, through to when we invest in the company they create. This team catalyses the work done by our Talent and Admissions efforts. This is the core of EF’s unique methodology. 
The total Toronto Team, which you'll be an integral part of, has the following responsibilities: 
 Talent and Admissions Support pre-EF’s initial offer. 
As Form Manager, you won't just be involved in company building, but in finding the best early stage founders too. You will encourage the smartest and highest potential candidates to apply to the programme, then identify the best and brightest applicants from the pool. This is a unique challenge: no other organisation has found a way of assessing individuals’ raw potential to be founders.
Participate in our talent outreach through sourcing pipelines and high touch interactions
Support the selection and interview process
 Cultivation. Ensure everyone we offer to join EF, joins. 
Every person we offer that doesn’t join is a missed opportunity to build something massive. Your mission is to ensure offer holders know EF is the highest value use of their time. Joining EF should be as extraordinary an experience as joining Harvard, McKinsey, or Google.
Create a world class pre-joining experience for offer holders.
Spend time with offer holders to ensure they join.
Problem solve with selected offer holders to prepare them. 
 Team building. Crack the code for founding teams. 
As Form Manager, you'll have responsibility for the quality of companies that are created during EF Form. We have developed a robust team building method. But, there is still much to learn. Your mission is to build as many strong teams as possible.
Work with sole founders to help them progress into teams.
Actively manage team breakups and formation.
Develop EF's team building frameworks.
Use EF's data to create optimal co-founding teams. 
 Ideation. Ensure the teams work on high potential ideas 
We influence what ideas EF founders work on enormously. Your mission is to make these ideas as high potential as possible.
Work with EF founders to develop their ideas.
Develop EF's frameworks on ideation.

Requirements
You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role. You should have a high EQ and be able to move between moments of high intensity decision making as well as emotive and difficult interpersonal situations.

Experience: You should:
Be a strong execution-oriented problem solver. 
Have been a founder or worked in an early-stage startup.
Worked at a top tier company.
Worked in or with startups at a senior level.
Personal: You will:
Be an expert problem solver who thinks on their feet
Have high EQ and enjoy working with people
Be an engaged upside thinker
Be extremely ambitious
Have a strong growth mindset
Have outstanding organisational skills
Be a strong communicator
Be very comfortable with managing competing priorities
Training and development
Your experience will be invaluable, but nowhere are startups built the way they are built at EF. We will teach you the method we have taken 8 years to create. 
Reporting: You will report to our General Manager (François Le Nguyen) and manage a team of Associates and Entrepreneurs-in-Residence (3-4 people). 
Benefits
In addition to the financial compensation, the benefits of working at EF include:
Surrounding yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to be an early employee at an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people approach entrepreneurship in Canada. The potential impact is enormous.
Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work in a talented, ambitious, and committed team of specialists.
Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best technologists, founders, investors and high net worth individuals.
Working in a buzzing space full of technical founders and being part of an enthusiastic and fast-paced team.
In addition to 23 holiday days to use flexibly between January and December, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year.
A Learning and Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development.
A Wellness allowance: everyone gets a wellness allowance to be spent on things that enhance your health and wellbeing e.g. gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace etc.
Annual retreats with our Global team
A generous maternity and paternity pay and leave policies. We care about your families and we want to enable you to achieve the right balance between your home and working life.


Remuneration  
This is a Manager level role, with a competitive salary and performance based remuneration. This role can expect significant upside from our fund through our carry plan.
Location: You will be based in EF's Toronto office (location TBD), with periodic training in London.
Start Date: December 2019, with our inaugural cohort starting Q2 2020.

EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual preference, age, disability, or marital status.

Surrounding yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to be an early employee at an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people approach entrepreneurship in Canada. The potential impact is enormous.
Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work in a talented, ambitious, and committed team of specialists.
Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best technologists, founders, investors and high net worth individuals.
Working in a buzzing space full of technical founders and being part of an enthusiastic and fast-paced team.
In addition to 23 holiday days to use flexibly between January and December, we also close the office down for two weeks over Christmas and New Year.
A Learning and Development allowance to purchase any product or service that will contribute to your personal or professional development.
A Wellness allowance: everyone gets a wellness allowance to be spent on things that enhance your health and wellbeing e.g. gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace etc.
Annual retreats with our Global team
A generous maternity and paternity pay and leave policies. We care about your families and we want to enable you to achieve the right balance between your home and working life.

Remuneration

This is a Manager level role, with a competitive salary and performance based remuneration. This role can expect significant upside from our fund through our carry plan.
Location: You will be based in EF's Toronto office (location TBD), with periodic training in London.
Start Date: December 2019, with our inaugural cohort starting Q2 2020.

EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual preference, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Founder - HealthTech/FinTech/EdTech/Logistics/eCommerce
jobs.description:
**It matters what the most ambitious and talented people do with their lives.
**

Entrepreneur First is the world’s leading talent investor. We invest time and money in the world’s most talented and ambitious individuals, helping them to find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a company. So far, we’ve helped 1,000+ people create 200+ companies, worth a combined $1.5bn.

**About the programme**
1. The programme runs for 6-9 months, full-time in Bangalore.
2. For the first 3 months, we focus on helping you find the right co-founder from a carefully selected pool and develop your idea. You are paid a monthly stipend of US$2,000.
3. At the end of 3 months, you pitch to our Investment Committee to receive pre-seed funding and join the second part of the programme. 
4. The second part of the programme focused on preparing you to raise your next round of seed funding with external investors.
5. At the 6th month mark of the programme, we gather many established investors in our region on an Investor Day, to hear the companies pitch and help you raise seed investment.


**Who we look for**
Individuals with extensive experience in specific industries, holding deep insights and wide network.

The next cohort starts 3rd August. Apply at https://bit.ly/3dgFtRS by 31 May.

jobs.title: Growth Associate, Europe
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First
Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor; we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.

Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 1,200 individuals build more than 200 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.

EF itself is backed by some of the world’s best investors, including the founders of LinkedIn, DeepMind and PayPal and runs cohorts in London, Singapore, Hong Kong, Berlin, Paris and Bangalore. 

The Role
We are on the lookout for an Associate who will play a vital role in making Entrepreneur First the default career preference for the most ambitious individuals in the UK. Your primary responsibility will be to identify, contact and convert exceptionally talented individuals to learn more about EF, and ultimately apply. This role sits within our Growth and Marketing function, and works closely with the teams in our Berlin, Paris and London teams.

Identifying Talent (30%) 
You will independently lead on finding exceptional individuals and real outliers we EF should invest in. You have the challenging but incredibly exciting task of finding world-class founders before they are founders. You will be responsible for maintaining a healthy pipeline of new leads to engage and assess, in line with targets. To help you, you'll use in-depth criteria we have formed, and work closely with Local Talent Managers and General Managers to get feedback. You’ll use tools like LinkedIn Recruiter, ResearchGate, and GitHub, as well as other non-conventional sources like Twitter, competition rankings and university websites.

Contacting and Engaging Individuals (40%) 
You will lead on the first communications and outreach to those individuals, in most cases catalysing their interest in EF and entrepreneurship. You'll get to experiment with different forms of outreach and copy, but always maintaining a personalised approach. Your mission will be to convert those leads to have a further conversation with a member of the EF team. As you become more experienced, you will develop processes and best practices to optimise sourcing and positive response rate, ultimately creating an intelligent and efficient sourcing function.

Stakeholder Management (15%)
Get regular feedback from Local Talent Teams on the leads engaged. Report weekly on progress against targets, keeping all stakeholders in the loop on progress.

Data Management and Reporting (15%)
Ensure you maintain our CRM as a single source of truth for leads contacted and engaged.

About You
* You are a target-driven individual who thinks in pipelines and digs deep to make improvements at every stage.
* You are a highly organised self-starter who gets things done.
* You are a team player, who is motivated by achieving shared goals and able to adapt to changing needs and circumstances.
* You are a quick learner who thrives in fast-paced environments, and is and able to adapt to changing needs and circumstances.
* You are a clear communicator who is comfortable engaging in conversation and managing relationships with multiple leads and stakeholders. 
* You’re able to handle all situations and data sensitively and in confidence.
* You are interested in building a career in talent-investing, growth, marketing.

It is also desirable, but not essential if you have:
* 6 month - 1 year of relevant work experience, such as in recruitment, talent, marketing or sales
* Familiarity with the UK university and tech ecosystems
 
Why Join?
* Be part of an ambitious team redefining what the most ambitious people do with their lives.
* Get exposure to founders of globally ambitious startups, as they go through their company-building journey.
* Make connections within the EF network of leading technologists, founders, and investors.
* L&D allowance to put towards your personal development
* £400 wellness allowance to put towards Wellness Activities (gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace, etc.)
* Parental Leave: a generous parental leave scheme, 16 weeks fully paid for mothers/primary carers and 6 weeks for fathers/partners plus a flexible return to work schedule
* 23 days’ holiday (excluding bank holidays) + 2 weeks at Christmas




Thank you for reading about this role. EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Head of Global PR & Communications
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First  
Entrepreneur First is the world’s leading talent investor. We believe the best way for the most impactful & ambitious people to fulfil their potential is to build companies. We transform their lives by enabling them to become founders.   
Since 2012, we’ve pioneered a new model of company creation: we bring together extremely talented people from academia and industry to build the next generation of globally ambitious technology startups from scratch. We fund individuals in London, Singapore, Berlin, Paris, Bangalore and Toronto to find a world-class co-founder, develop an idea with support from a network of experienced mentors, and raise money from the world's best investors.  
Over 2,000 individuals have taken our programmes, creating 200+ companies and raising over $500m of investment with a combined valuation of over $2 billion. We're backed by some of the world's best tech founders and investors, including Reid Hoffman (LinkedIn), Greylock Partners, Founders Fund, Demis Hassabis (Google Deepmind) and Taavet Hinrikus (TransferWise).  
About the role  
In the last 18 months we’ve closed our first global fund ($100M+) and expanded to run our programmes in 4 new locations across India, Europe and North America. We’re now looking for a Head of Global PR & Communications to lead and execute on a world-class global PR and communications strategy across our 6 locations, cementing our brand, perfecting our messages, and setting us up for future growth.   
A great opportunity for the right person, this role has huge scope and vast opportunity. You will bring your industry experience, domain expertise, creativity and results-driven approach to work with stakeholders across the company, from our founders to local teams, our cohorts of talented individuals and alumni as they build and scale the next generation of globally ambitious technology companies.  
You will work directly with and manage our local agency partners to ensure our stories get told globally: for us as the world’s leading talent investor, for the talented individuals we fund, and for the companies they build. In doing so you will have the opportunity to learn about – and experience first-hand – the workings and growth of a globally unique talent investor working with cutting edge entrepreneurs on world changing technologies.  
This is a global role, based in our London HQ and directly managing internal and external relationships across timezones from Asia to North America.

jobs.title: Operations Analyst (Intern)
jobs.description:
Entrepreneur First is the **world's leading talent investor**.

We invest in the world’s most ambitious technologists to help them build **world-class deep tech startups from scratch**. Since 2011, we’ve created over 200+ startups worth over $1.5 billion including Tractable, OpenCosmos, CloudNC and Cleo. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony, which was acquired by Twitter for a $150m. EF is backed by Reid Hoffman (founder of LinkedIn) and Greylock Partners, Mosaic Ventures, Founders Fund, Lakestar and some of the world's best entrepreneurs.

It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Over the past 5 years, we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates **some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia**. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. No other organisation has access to this.

**Responsibilities**

At EF, we have developed a robust team-building method and also strongly influence what ideas EF founders work on. Your mission will be to support the programme team in **cracking the code for turning exceptional individuals into high quality teams working on ambitious, high potential ideas**.

- **1. Operations:** You will support the EF team in handling the day-to-day operations of the Form and Launch programmes, through the moment people are first contacted until they have an investable startup. Your role will be crucial in ensuring a smooth running of the programme, from onboarding individuals to helping them form teams and generate ideas, all the way through to Investment Committee preparation, incorporation and fundraising. 
- **2. Founders' experience: ** Founders are our customers and we want to make sure they have a memorable experience on the programme. You will be responsible for closely working with them to anticipate and resolve potential challenges that they may face throughout the course of their company-building journey. 
- **3. Community and partnerships with key stakeholders** : At the heart of EF’s long term defensibility is our ability to attract the best talent and provide the best programme. Building long term relationships startup services providers as well as other organisations from the ecosystem is key. Your internship will also be a great opportunity to interact with the broader tech and VC community in Paris as we increasingly extend our reach.

**You will also get to:**

- Surround yourself with the **world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals** and have the opportunity to help develop an institution that can transform the lives of the most impactful people
- **Supercharge your learning** - you will have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team
- Embed yourself within the EF network - we **work with the best founders and investors** in France
- Shadow and then **lead individual meetings with founders** , including mock investor questions sessions
- Be **based at Station F** , at the heart of the French tech ecosystem

**Experience**

You should:

- Have a strong academic record
- Have already interned at a top tier company or startup
- Have a strong interest in the tech, startup and venture capital ecosystem
- Be perfectly fluent in English

**Personal**

You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role.

You will also:

- Have outstanding organisational skills
- Be an expert problem solver who thinks on their feet
- Have high EQ and enjoy working with people
- Have a strong growth mindset
- Be a strong communicator
- Be very comfortable with managing competing priorities

**Remuneration** : You will be paid **1,**** 500 euros** per month.

**Location** : You will be based in EF's offices at **Station F** , 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris

**Start Date** : December 2019 to January 2020

[https://www.joinef.com/](https://www.joinef.com/)

Experience

- Have an interest in technology, startups and venture capital

- Be perfectly fluent in spoken and written English

Requirements
You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role.
You should also:
- Be an expert problem solver who thinks on their feet
- Have high EQ and enjoy working with people
- Have a strong growth mindset and actively seek ownership
- Have outstanding organisational skills
- Be a strong communicator
- Be very comfortable with managing competing priorities

Remuneration: You will be paid 1,500 euros per month.  
Location: You will be based in EF's offices at Station F, 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris.

  • Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals and have the opportunity to help develop an institution that can transform the lives of the most impactful people
  • Supercharge your learning - you will have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team
  • Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in France
  • Shadow the individual meetings with founders, including mock investor questions sessions
  • Be based at Station F, at the heart of the French tech ecosystem

Experience
You should:

  • Have a strong academic record
  • Have an interest in technology, startups and venture capital
  • Have already interned at a top tier company or startup
  • Be perfectly fluent in spoken and written English

Requirements
You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role.
You should also:

  • Be an expert problem solver who thinks on their feet
  • Have high EQ and enjoy working with people
  • Have a strong growth mindset and actively seek ownership
  • Have outstanding organisational skills
  • Be a strong communicator
  • Be very comfortable with managing competing priorities

Remuneration: You will be paid 1,500 euros per month.

Location: You will be based in EF's offices at Station F, 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris.
Start Date: Mid-June / early July 2020 for 6 months
https://www.joinef.com/

We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

jobs.title: Talent - Events & Partnerships
jobs.description:
Who are Entrepreneur First?

Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies. We are the world’s leading talent investor; we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them start a technology company from scratch.
Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 1,200 individuals build more than 200 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.

Whats the role?

At EF, a key part of our work is building a community of ambitious people who might one day seek to start their own business. This role sits within our Talent team, acting as our lead for Events & Partnerships in the UK. The overall responsibility of talent, is to leverage our network to increase applicants to the programmes we run, which makes this role vital to success in 2020! 

What type of events do we run? 

Everything from 200 invitees for talks with some of the world’s most famous Entrepreneurs and Investors (Most notably Reid Hoffman, founder of Linkedin & investor in EF), to intimate dinners on innovation and deep technology. We aim to educate and inspire, demystifying the world of venture capital allowing those with the right talent to bring their ideas to life.

What type of partnerships are we seeking? 

Anywhere top talent exists, we want to be there. World leading universities, highly selective research grants and niche communities all fall under the umbrella of great talent incubators. We work in partnership with these institutions to drive compelling events that help our community understand how to take their competitive edge to the next level

Who do you need to be? 

The ideal person will be comfortable leading the management of events and most importantly able to identify new ways to reach more people. They will be tenacious in approach, appreciate every detail and lead on creative projects. 

Ideal background 

2 - 5 years in event creation and management 
Have previously formed partnerships with universities or programmes 
Strong interest in entrepreneurship/venture capital
Understanding of recruiting or talent funnels 
Confident communicator with ability to deal with senior stakeholders

Please note there is flexibility in our requirements for the right person. If you feel you can add value please get in touch!

Why Join? 

We’re a highly motivated team redefining what the most ambitious people do with their lives. We find outliers and support their growth to some of the most cutting edge technologies in the world. You’ll have massive exposure to this culture of creativity as founders go through their journey. Alongside this incredible environment you’ll also get  

L&D Allowance to put towards your personal development
Wellness Allowance to put towards Wellness Activities (gym memberships, yoga classes, running shoes, subscription to Headspace, etc.)
Parental Leave: a generous parental leave scheme, 16 weeks fully paid for mothers/primary carers and 6 weeks for fathers/partners plus a flexible return to work schedule
Laptop Allowance to choose the equipment that will help you to do your job most effectively - depending what this looks like for you.
Global Retreats: Annual get-togethers with our global colleagues. 
23 days’ holiday (excluding bank holidays) + 2 weeks at Christmas 
Working hours - 9.30am - 5.30pm 

How to apply 

If you’ve read this far, maybe you’ll come a little further. CV’s are great but conversations are better so please get in touch to let us know you’re open to a chat! We’re eager to get you in as soon as possible to help set in motion big plans for 2020. 

Talk soon!

jobs.title: Talent Acquisition Analyst (Intern)
jobs.description:
Entrepreneur First is the **world's leading talent investor**.

We invest in the world’s most ambitious technologists to help them build **world-class deep tech startups from scratch**. Since 2011, we’ve created over 200+ startups worth over $1.5 billion including Tractable, OpenCosmos, CloudNC and Cleo. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology, which was acquired by Twitter for a $150m. EF is backed by Reid Hoffman (founder of LinkedIn) and Greylock Partners, Mosaic Ventures, Founders Fund, Lakestar and some of the world's best entrepreneurs.

It once seemed impossible to build companies from scratch. Over the past 5 years, we've built a robust, scalable way to do this. Our method creates **some of the most valuable startups produced in Europe and Asia**. EF has a unique opportunity to develop the secret to building billion dollar companies from scratch. No other organisation has access to this.

**Responsibilities**

As an intern in the Talent team, you will be helping us **find and attract the world’s best technical individuals** to join EF and build deep tech startups. Your main responsibilities will revolve around:

- **1. Sourcing. ** You will be responsible for finding exceptional individuals we should invest in. You will have the challenging but incredibly exciting task of finding world class founders before they are founders. You will use tools like LinkedIn Recruiter, ResearchGate, and GitHub, as well as other non-conventional sources like Twitter, and online articles. You will work directly with the Talent teams in London, Paris and Berlin to define and improve criteria used to identify those individuals.
- **2. Outreach**. You will lead on the first communications and outreach to those individuals, sparking their interest in EF and entrepreneurship. You will develop processes and best practices to optimise positive response rate, ultimately creating an intelligent and efficient sourcing function.
- **3. Pipeline management and reporting**. You will be responsible for maintaining a healthy pipeline of new leads to engage, in line with targets and criteria.You will report weekly on progress against targets and on any experiments.

**You will also get to:**

- Surround yourself with the **world’s smartest and most ambitious individuals** and have the opportunity to help develop an institution that can transform the lives of the most impactful people
- Embed yourself within the EF network - we **work with the best founders and investors** in France
- Be **based at Station F** , at the heart of the French tech ecosystem

**Experience**

You should:

- Have a strong academic record
- Have an interest in the tech and startup ecosystem
- Be perfectly fluent in English and French

**Requirements**

You should excel with process and people, be strategic but enjoy getting your hands dirty and want a fast paced role.

You will also:

- Have good organisational skills
- Enjoy working with people
- Have a strong growth mindset
- Be a good communicator
- Be comfortable with managing competing priorities

**Remuneration** : You will be paid **1,**** 500 euros** per month.

**Location** : You will be based in EF's offices at **Station F** , 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris.

**Start Date** : December 2019 to January 2020.

[https://www.joinef.com/](https://www.joinef.com/)

jobs.title: Talent Manager, Bangalore
jobs.description:
About Entrepreneur First

Entrepreneur First was founded in 2011 by Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford with the aim of enabling the world’s most ambitious people to build the most important companies, and that is still true today. We are the world’s leading talent investor - we invest time and money in outstanding individuals, helping them find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a technology company from scratch.  Across our programmes in Europe and Asia, to date we have helped over 2000 individuals build more than 230 companies, with a total valuation of $1.5 billion. EF’s companies have been funded by many of the leading venture investors in Europe, Asia and Silicon Valley. Our major exits to date include Magic Pony Technology which was acquired by Twitter for a reported $150m only 18 months after the Founders met on the EF programme.

EF now faces the biggest and most exciting challenge in its history: scaling to become a globally important institution. To be accessible and attractive to the world’s most ambitious people, we have launched EF in Bangalore, already with our the third cohort well underway.  Our Talent Manager will be part of the India management team; creating EF culture, and work across the spectrum of functions at the company.

The Role
There are two main aspects to this Talent Manager role:

Identifying and accessing high potential founders
Talent is our number one operating priority and as Talent Manager, you will deliver the EF process of helping build startups from scratch by identifying and sourcing top talent for the EF programme in Bangalore. You have to make sure that the world’s best potential founders want to join EF.

Your team’s primary responsibility is to design, drive and manage EF’s Talent strategy in Bangalore going forward. This means you will be shaping and innovating the ways and processes in which we engage smart, talented individuals with strong founder potential, and encourage them to join us and start companies. You need to define what good founders look like, find ways to identify them and build bridges to connect with them. You will be collaborating with the APAC team in Singapore to constantly iterate the process and build an efficient system in place.


Partnerships
Building a EF as a formidable brand in India. We want to be  thought leaders in this space and you will be owning this process in India and work in tandem with our marketing team in London. You will develop and design content that establishes EF as a thought leader in the startup ecosystem. 

This role includes but is not limited to:
* Developing a marketing strategy for EF in India - social media, events, campaigns etc
* Strengthen ties with our existing partners and build new ones
* Develop our network with startup bodies, tech forums and institutions, etc
* Managing a 'pipeline' of ambitious, exceptional individuals who can potentially build the next billion-dollar startup in the country
* Developing a sales/business development strategy for attracting the best individuals in the country to the EF program 

About You

* You have a highly credible background with 6-8+ years of experience in Business Development, Sales, Customer Success, Relationship Management, Campus / University Relations or other sales roles
* You excel in a fast paced, high growth environment
* You’ve had exposure to running a team, mentoring people and know what it takes to build a high performance organisation.
* You have strong communication and presentation skills, plus excellent organisational ability / process excellence
* You're comfortable working in cross geography and functional teams with multiple stakeholders.
* You have the ability to manage and build peer-like relationships with stakeholders at the highest level, including investors, government officials, academics and university staff
* You have a proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas. Bonus points if you've led sales teams in startups!

You will also get to:
Surround yourself with the world’s smartest and most exceptional individuals and have the opportunity to work in an institution that is changing the way the most ambitious people think about their careers.  Supercharge your learning - you’ll have a very steep learning curve and work alongside a talented, ambitious, and committed team.  Embed yourself within the EF network - we work with the best founders and investors in the region.  Work in a diverse, distributed, global team and learn best practices from teams around the world

Details
Reporting: You will report to Esha Tiwary, GM for EF India
Location and Start Date: You’ll be based at our Bangalore office in HSR Layout and would start as soon as possible (March 2020).


EF champions diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment in which a variety of backgrounds thrive. We do not tolerate discrimination of any nature including but not limited to discriminating on the basis of race, colour, religion, culture, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual preference, age, disability, or marital status.
